channel.title: FunOrb Hacking Question
channel.description:
Ok, so just to start on something a bit more simple, I decided to fool around with FunOrb games, specifically the chess one. My goal is to make a modified chess client just so I can read off the current positions of the pieces. Sounds simple, but I can't get started.
First off, I managed to get the loader_blahblah.jar file and extract it. Decompiled with jad and had a look inside. Obfuscated as expected. Now a few questions:
1. Where do I get the main jar file? What is it called? How do I find out how to get it? 2. I want to be able to load a modified client once I fool around with it. How do I do this?
Any help would be much appreciated.

item.title: FunOrb Hacking Question
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

iunno something liek

<blah> <search> <iload /> <iconst_m1 /> <ixor /> <bipush /> <icmp /> </search> <replace> <backref to da iload /> <bipush><func_xor>backref to da bipush value</func_xor></bipush> <backref to da icmp /> </replace> </blah>
for one case

if you write your parser so that it doesnt suck cocks, you will be able to do it

Read full topic

item.title: FunOrb Hacking Question
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:11, topic:187605”][quote author=BAsh(CntLgn) link=topic=250223.msg2098678#msg2098678 date=1205086044]

my jagex deobfuscator is undergo.
wont be long now till its ready!

(tis a long term project of mine, atm writing patterns for the pattern searcher, im using xml for the patterns with regex, so you can define your own pattern and pattern fixes, but yet to decide if thats sensible?)

I originally used that design with javascript for the actual editing. Ie there was the definition and then the actual action written in javascript. It was okay in terms of speed providing you compile the scripts before hand so they don’t have to be compiled every time you do the action. Problem with that approach is that the xml is too restrictive so you have to create either a bunch of special cases or glue it together with javascript. Once you get into javascript though things start acting differently. For example you now have everything in doubles so when you xor an int (32bits) you get something completely different to what you were expecting (a large negative number). This caused me to use nested classes to achieve it. For example: new ComplexCondition(insnOpcode, new ValueCondition(…), new AnyCondition()).
[/quote]… what? xml isnt restrictive at all[/quote]
So how would you describe in xml to match a ‘not’ and remove it?

Read full topic

wont be long now till its ready!

(tis a long term project of mine, atm writing patterns for the pattern searcher, im using xml for the patterns with regex, so you can define your own pattern and pattern fixes, but yet to decide if thats sensible?)
[/quote]

I originally used that design with javascript for the actual editing. Ie there was the definition and then the actual action written in javascript. It was okay in terms of speed providing you compile the scripts before hand so they don’t have to be compiled every time you do the action. Problem with that approach is that the xml is too restrictive so you have to create either a bunch of special cases or glue it together with javascript. Once you get into javascript though things start acting differently. For example you now have everything in doubles so when you xor an int (32bits) you get something completely different to what you were expecting (a large negative number). This caused me to use nested classes to achieve it. For example: new ComplexCondition(insnOpcode, new ValueCondition(…), new AnyCondition()).[/quote]… what? xml isnt restrictive at all

item.title: FunOrb Hacking Question
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Chess doesn’t have a main void, so write a class which loads the applet.
I’m working on a deobfuscater myself aswell :P, I think I’m going to make a chess bot. (There are a lot of opensource chess bots available)

You can also just extract the game from your cache, because it’s stored the same as rs.

Read full topic

item.title: FunOrb Hacking Question
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:5, topic:187605”]my jagex deobfuscator is undergo.
wont be long now till its ready!

(tis a long term project of mine, atm writing patterns for the pattern searcher, im using xml for the patterns with regex, so you can define your own pattern and pattern fixes, but yet to decide if thats sensible?)[/quote]

I originally used that design with javascript for the actual editing. Ie there was the definition and then the actual action written in javascript. It was okay in terms of speed providing you compile the scripts before hand so they don’t have to be compiled every time you do the action. Problem with that approach is that the xml is too restrictive so you have to create either a bunch of special cases or glue it together with javascript. Once you get into javascript though things start acting differently. For example you now have everything in doubles so when you xor an int (32bits) you get something completely different to what you were expecting (a large negative number). This caused me to use nested classes to achieve it. For example: new ComplexCondition(insnOpcode, new ValueCondition(…), new AnyCondition()).

Read full topic

Ok, using unsigned, I got the client jar. Now I need to load it somehow…

item.title: FunOrb Hacking Question
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

[quote=“solarwind, post:1, topic:187605”]Ok, so just to start on something a bit more simple, I decided to fool around with FunOrb games, specifically the chess one. My goal is to make a modified chess client just so I can read off the current positions of the pieces. Sounds simple, but I can’t get started.

First off, I managed to get the loader_blahblah.jar file and extract it. Decompiled with jad and had a look inside. Obfuscated as expected. Now a few questions:

  1. Where do I get the main jar file? What is it called? How do I find out how to get it?
  2. I want to be able to load a modified client once I fool around with it. How do I do this?

Any help would be much appreciated.[/quote]

I suspect the majority of the abstraction that the client has recently under went is due to the desire that Jagex has to produce these games… Although I lack funorb membership, I’ll readily assume they’re the same engine.

Read full topic

chances are that it wont be deobfuscated properly
